p:
In addition to the future projection of storm tides from each climate model, we also calculate a single composite projection which represents the weighted–average value over all climate models. The weighting factor assigned to each climate model is determined by comparing the NCEP-based storm tide return levels with those projected by the climate models for the historical period. Specifically, the weighting factor W
i of the climate model i is simply calculated as W
i = S
i /∑S i, where S
i is the Wilmott skill score (0 < S < 1, S = 1 means a perfect fit) for estimating the storm tide return levels.
